For this we apologize, but ask anyone viewing this page to keep in mind that diversity, inclusivity, and women’s health shouldn’t be partisan or political issues. These are things everyone, except America’s most notorious crypto-fascist demagogue, can agree on.

column1: • We could be doing this too late. In fact, we know we already are. There was a point when we were being entertained by the political theatre, but even then we should have been putting in serious effort to highlight how damaging and dangerous Trump really is. As Arianna Huffington noted: we’re no longer entertained. It’s time for all us to do something to address this problem.
","Overview

America is a great place. There are always some things that could be better, but it’s undoubtedly a great place. Yet here we have this fella Trump saying it’s broken, and his prescription for making it great is to go back in time.
The policies he is espousing would take us back centuries.

America is a nation of immigrants founded by people who fled religious persecution. If Trump wants to curtail immigration and limit religious freedom then he’s looking to unmake the country from its very foundation. We don't mean to slight to our friends in the United Kingdom with this message, we're simply noting how far back in time Trump is trying to drag the country.

So we’re doing something about it: selling ironic Trump hats. By wearing a Make America Great Britain Again hat, you’re not just making a statement that you think Trump is epically regressive, but you’re also actively supporting three organisations who are doing the hard work to make America a more diverse, safe, inclusive and pluralistic.
Causes

When You Help Us Go... You're Part Of The Solution

The Dominican Republic is a third world country where a meal a day can be a luxury...  and a nutritious meal ALWAYS is.
When families can't feed their kids, those children often become victims of something WORSE than hunger:  sexual exploitation.
Our ministry is 20 years old and still going... making a difference where the difference counts.

column3: >Give where you know it will matter.
>We need only $2500 to send all three -- Scott Smith, Scarlet Smith and Gianna Smith -- to the Dominican.  Gospel-driven with a heart for the hurting, they're making the trip.
>Not only are they making the trip themselves, but have already contributed a substantial amount from their own resources to help themselves go.

column1: The trip will take place at the end of May through early June for a week.

When  you help us work with established ministries in the Dominican Republic, you are essentially giving toward MOMENTUM. You are helping those who are breaking the cycle of hunger and exploitation of children in a country where few will fight for justice.
While you cannot go, we will.  And your help is part of the solution.

Help us go to the ""least of these"" and be a part of stemming the tide of lack and victimization.

Zach Johnson works for a non-profit organization helping the homeless men and women of Minneapolis find permanent housing.
In order to do this important work, he needs to be able to connect with the homeless on foot or on bicycle.
Last weekend, his bicycle, which was locked to a designated bike rack in a gated area, was stolen by thieves who climbed the fence and sawed through the bike rack and lock.
Let's help Zach get back to doing his important work by helping him get a new bicycle.
See The Story:

http://www.viterbo.edu/Magazine/magazine/april12/default.html#page/18

REFUGEES WELCOME - Regional Helfen

Auch wir möchten uns in der aktuellen Debatte in Bezug auf Menschen, die geflüchtet sind, klar positionieren.

Wir solidarisieren uns mit diesen Menschen. Ob es sich um politisch Verfolgte handelt, um Menschen, die vor Krieg und Terror fliehen, oder Menschen, die aufgrund finanzieller Not, gezwungen sind ihre Heimat zu verlassen, spielt keine Rolle. Dabei sollte nicht vergessen werden, dass postkoloniale Strukturen und/oder die westliche, neo-kolonialistische Politik zu den Hauptursachen gehören.

Seit März diesen Jahres wohnen 100 Menschen in einer kleinen Container-Siedlung am Ortsrand von Garching b. München. Auf der gegenüberliegenden Seite der Felder findet unser Schall im Schilf Open-Air statt. Dort tanzen wir sorglos in der untergehenden Sonne und versuchen dem Alltag zu entkommen. Wenige hundert Meter entfernt wünschen sich einige Menschen nichts sehnlicher als diesen. Anfang November finden hier 150 weitere Leute ein vorübergehendes Zuhause. Wir haben mit der Garchinger Integrationsbeauftragten Frau Stanglmeier besprochen, wo wir sinnvoll mit anpacken können:


Es werden dringend Sprachlehrbücher und Schreibmaterial benötigt. Die Kosten für ein solches Lernpaket belaufen sich auf etwa 15€ pro Person.

Wir wollen für alle 150 neu ankommende Personen in Garching diese Lernpakete finanzieren und dabei könnt ihr uns helfen:

Insgesamt werden bis Ende Oktober 2250 € Euro benötigt.

Jeder noch so geringe Beitrag von Euch ist eine große Hilfe und herzlich willkommen. Kellerkind übernimmt die ersten 50 %, bei der zweiten Hälfte hoffen wir auf Euch. Keine Spende ist zu viel: Falls wir das Ziel mit Euch übertreffen geht der Überschuss an Refugio-München. Refugio ist ein Behandlungs- und Beratungszentrum für Menschen, die geflüchtet sind. Mehr Infos unter:
column4:
s=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">http://www.refugio-muenchen.de/kurzportrait.php?sprache=de

Warum Sprachbücher?

Sprache ist der Schlüssel zu gesellschaftlicher Teilhabe. Sprache gibt die Möglichkeit Rechte geltend zu machen und ist ein kleiner Schritt in Richtung Unabhängigkeit. Zusätzlich erhöhen Sprachkenntnisse die Chancen auf einen Arbeitsplatz. Sprache reicht hier jedoch nicht aus, denn den meisten dieser Menschen wird die Ausübung eines Berufes durch die Gesetzgebung sehr erschwert oder untersagt. Mehr Infos dazu findet ihr hier:
column7:
s=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">http://www.proasyl.de/…/bayern_setzt_mit_arbeitsverboten_a…/

Die aktuellen Hilfsaktionen sind extrem wichtig, und wir freuen uns über die vielen positiven Reaktionen der Menschen. Die Gründe dafür, dass so viele Leute fliehen müssen haben aber auch viel mit unserer Gesellschaft zu tun. Daher ist es wichtig auch bestehende Strukturen zu hinterfragen um etwas grundlegend ändern zu können.
Wir möchten darauf aufmerksam machen, dass Rassismus in Deutschland nicht nur ein individuelles Problem ist. Ganz im Gegenteil ist Rassismus in vielen gesellschaftlichen Strukturen und den öffentlichen Medien zu finden. Es ist kein isoliertes Problem am rechten Rand, sondern betrifft auch die gesellschaftliche Mitte. Dies allein ist schlimm genug, bereitet aber zusätzlich den Boden für extreme Aktionen (z.B. Gewalttaten und offene Anfeindungen). Diese Leute sind zum Glück nicht die Mehrheit!

Weitere Infos:

Kämpfer gegen den Alltagsrassismus - Hamado Dipama erzählt von seinen Erfahrungen in Deutschland:
column13:
s=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">http://www.spiegel.de/…/fluechtlinge-in-deutschland-antwort…

Das schlimmste Wort in der Asyldebatte:

http://www.wienerzeitung.at/…/766535_Das-schlimmste-Wort-de…

THE STORY

The synthesis of music and photography came early, it all started at age 14 when I was at a rock and roll concert in a small, intimate theater in New Jersey. At the concert, older friends were photographing this cool English rock band 'The Kink's', and I found myself becoming fascinated by their little black machines with the tiny white numbers, the next day I followed them into the darkroom and that very afternoon I decided to become a photographer. I earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree from The School of Visual Arts and a Associate of Science Degree from Endicott College. I moved to Europe where I began my career in fashion photography. During the last twenty years my fashion and celebrity photographs have appeared in numerous international magazines, represented by galleries and private collectors, as well as shown in international photography exhibitions.

In 2015 I spearheaded a Indiegogo fundraiser for 'Breakthrough', a human rights organization in India, which works to make violence against girls and women unacceptable. Our goal was $10,000.00 and we raised $12,000.00 during our 60 day campaign on Indiegogo, it was a great success!

In 1990 I moved to Europe on my own and traveled around by train exploring as much as I could afford. My camera was my steady companion photographing strangers on the streets of European villages and wandering the large unknown cities. In recollection it was a mix of inspiration, excitement and loneliness, loneliness until I heard music and music that I knew, wafting from cars, bars and houses and suddenly I didn't feel alone, I felt someone knew me, and I knew them, music and photography became my companions. With these memories a fundraiser is born.

MUSIC HEALS, MUSIC EQUALIZES, MUSIC BUILDS!                             

Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

PERKS = GIFTS = FOR YOU

This print collection is designed exclusively for the METAdrasi organization, each print is signed in a limited edition. Donors will receive my photographs of these iconic musicians, Sheryl Crow, Keith Richards, Aretha Franklin, Bjork, Moby and Lenny Kravitz. Please join me in contributing to this campaign, your funds will help refugee children live in safe housing which every child deserves! 

METAdrasi is a registered nonprofit organization so your donation is deductible to the extent of the law.  For your records, METAdrasi's Tax ID number is 997777147.

Thank you so much for your generosity and commitment of spirit!

PHOTOGRAPHS

Created exclusively for the METAdrasi organization, signed in a limited edition.

SHERYL CROW 'NIGHT IN THE CITY'  ©Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

KEITH RICHARDS 'INSIDE OUT'  ©Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

ARETHA FRANKLIN 'THE QUEEN'  ©Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

BJORK 'MAGIC DUST'  ©Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

MOBY 'BRAIN GAME'  ©Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

LENNY KRAVITZ 'SMOOTH LIKE VELVET'  ©Stephanie Pfriender Stylander

All photographs are printed on Archival Digital Luster Paper in size: 8.5 X 11 Inches, signed with edition. Full Set = Six Prints.

THIS FUNDRAISER IS FOR CHILDREN, CHILDREN THAT ARE ALONE

Today refugee children arrive on the shores of Greece unaccompanied, alone and vulnerable. Their parents are dead, they are separated from other family members, their countries are at war. These children must flee and they become targets for violence, high risk exploitation, abuse, smuggling and trafficking networks. METAdrasi ensures that vulnerable, unaccompanied children are offered shelter and the protection and care they are entitled to, it is after all, an essential human right!

The Crossing  © Massimo Sestini 

© Milos Bicanski/Getty Images

© Milos Bicanski/Getty Images

If it wasn't for an organization like METAdrasi refugee children end up in these deplorable, violent refugee camps or even worse on the streets.
column3:
showinfo=0"">
 

METAdrasi ORGANIZATION

http://metadrasi.org/en/metadrasi/

*(all photos of minors faces are covered for safety concerns)

METAdrasi is a key actor in the field of child protection, being the only Greek NGO that offers a comprehensive safety net of activities for the protection of unaccompanied and separated children. Seeking to eliminate the exposure of unaccompanied minors to the high risks of violence, abuse, exploitation and trafficking. It established and operates Transit Accommodation Facilities on the key reception islands of Lesvos, Samos, Chios as well as in the urban centers of Athens, Greece.

100% of the funding will directly go to METAdrasi 's Transit Accommodation Facilities that provide children with a safe, suitably-equipped space in accordance with their age. The specialized interdisciplinary groups (psychologists, social workers, special educators and nurses) and the support staff, along with the support of METAdrasi’s interpreters, offer children care, cover their everyday needs and provide psychological and social support, as well as health care and legal advice. The daily schedule of the children hosted is enriched with a variety of activities for their psychosocial development as well as  social, cultural, recreational and educational events that are organized in the facilities.

CHILDREN SAFE AND SOUND WITH METAdrasi

A unaccompanied child met by METAdrasi team members.

METAdrasi Housing/Accomodations

A METAdrasi housing facility.

A baby and children in their colorful, safe bedrooms.

Drawings let children express their fears, hopes and desires with a METAdrasi team member.

METAdrasi classroom.

Sports and having fun with METAdrasi team members.

During a joint project with university students. © Dimitris Voutsas

A METAdrasi housing facility.

When you put crayons, markers and pens in these children's hands, you have this!

""GREECE SEA IS DANGEROUS BUT IT IS HOPE FOR BRIGHT FUTURE FOR US""

*Drawn and written by one of the children.

METAdrasi NEED FUNDS! Please support my fundraiser! Give now! These children have suffered more than we can imagine!

Here is a breakdown of what the total funds of the fundraiser will do for METAdrasi:

-$15,000.00 USD would cover the yearly rent for one of the facilities.

-$10,000.00 USD would cover food costs of ALL the 4 accomodations for one month.

-$1000.00 USD would cover the recreational activities expenses for 15 children per month. 

-$350.00 USD would cover the monthly medical and pharmaceutical expenses for 15 children.

-All funding goes directly to METAdrasi, for the children to remain healthy in safe and clean accommodations. METAdrasi is a registered nonprofit organization so your donation is deductible to the extent of the law. For your records, METAdrasi's Tax ID number is 997777147.

BACKGROUND/PRESS

Lora Pappa is the founder and President of METAdrasi. Her main interest during her career has been to focus on work relating to the reception and integration of refugees. Lora worked for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, the Council for Refugees and the National Youth Foundation. She designed the operation of the first Hospitality Center for unaccompanied minors in Crete and the Hospitality Center of Unaccompanied Girls and Single Family Families of Refugees in Athens. Through all her extensive experience in the field, Lora was aiming to find the best possible ways for consolidating efforts and facilitating life conditions of refugees, and, particularly, unaccompanied minors. In 2010 METAdrasi was born a NGO for action for migration and development.

**Lora Pappa is the laureate of the 'Council of Europe North-South Prize', a distinction awarded annually, who stood out internationally for her role in defending human rights and democracy and for promoting dialogue, global interdependence and solidarity. 

** Britain's 'Guardian Newspaper' highlights METAdrasi's champion work in instituting shelter for the unaccompanied refugee children.

**A profile in 'Artnet' on Ai Weiwei the international artist who speaks of his experiences on the frontlines in Greece and how he created artworks from witnessing the migrant crisis first hand. He partially donated his proceeds to METAdrasi.

**Mandy Patinkin, the actor, visits several of the METAdrasi housing facilities to hear the children's stories and to put a spotlight on their plight. 

LET'S JOIN THE CHILDREN AND SEND LOVE TO METAdrasi BY FUNDING THEIR HUMANITARIAN EFFORTS AND BECOME A HUMANITARIAN OURSELVES. IT IS GREAT TO GIVE! THANK YOU FOR ALL YOU DO!

LOVE, STEPHANIE

I moved to Europe where I began my career in fashion photography. During the last twenty years my fashion and celebrity photographs have appeared in numerous international magazines, represented by galleries and private collectors, as well as shown in international photography exhibitions.

In 2015 I spearheaded a Indiegogo fundraiser for 'Breakthrough', a human rights organization in India, which works to make violence against girls and women unacceptable. Our goal was $10,000.00 and we raised $12,000.00 during our 60 day campaign on Indiegogo, it was a great success!

In 1990 I moved to Europe on my own and traveled around by train exploring as much as I could afford. My camera was my steady companion photographing strangers on the streets of European villages and wandering the large unknown cities. In recollection it was a mix of inspiration, excitement and loneliness, loneliness until I heard music and music that I knew, wafting from cars, bars and houses and suddenly I didn't feel alone, I felt someone knew me, and I knew them, music and photography became my companions. With these memories a fundraiser is born.MUSIC HEALS, MUSIC EQUALIZES, MUSIC BUILDS!                             Stephanie Pfriender StylanderPERKS = GIFTS = FOR YOUThis print collection is designed exclusively for the METAdrasi organization, each print is signed in a limited edition. Donors will receive my photographs of these iconic musicians, Sheryl Crow, Keith Richards, Aretha Franklin, Bjork, Moby and Lenny Kravitz. Please join me in contributing to this campaign, your funds will help refugee children live in safe housing which every child deserves! METAdrasi is a registered nonprofit organization so your donation is deductible to the extent of the law.  For your records, METAdrasi's Tax ID number is 997777147.Thank you so much for your generosity and commitment of spirit!PHOTOGRAPHSCreated exclusively for the METAdrasi organization, signed in a limited edition.SHERYL CROW 'NIGHT IN THE CITY'  ©Stephanie Pfriender StylanderKEITH RICHARDS 'INSIDE OUT'  ©Stephanie Pfriender StylanderARETHA FRANKLIN 'THE QUEEN'  ©Stephanie Pfriender StylanderBJORK 'MAGIC DUST'  ©Stephanie Pfriender StylanderMOBY 'BRAIN GAME'  ©Stephanie Pfriender StylanderLENNY KRAVITZ 'SMOOTH LIKE VELVET'  ©Stephanie Pfriender StylanderAll photographs are printed on Archival Digital Luster Paper in size: 8.5 X 11 Inches, signed with edition. Full Set = Six Prints.THIS FUNDRAISER IS FOR CHILDREN, CHILDREN THAT ARE ALONEToday refugee children arrive on the shores of Greece unaccompanied, alone and vulnerable. Their parents are dead, they are separated from other family members, their countries are at war. These children must flee and they become targets for violence, high risk exploitation, abuse, smuggling and trafficking networks. METAdrasi ensures that vulnerable, unaccompanied children are offered shelter and the protection and care they are entitled to, it is after all, an essential human right!The Crossing  © Massimo Sestini © Milos Bicanski/Getty Images© Milos Bicanski/Getty ImagesIf it wasn't for an organization like METAdrasi refugee children end up in these deplorable, violent refugee camps or even worse on the streets. METAdrasi ORGANIZATIONhttp://metadrasi.org/en/metadrasi/*(all photos of minors faces are covered for safety concerns)METAdrasi is a key actor in the field of child protection, being the only Greek NGO that offers a comprehensive safety net of activities for the protection of unaccompanied and separated children. Seeking to eliminate the exposure of unaccompanied minors to the high risks of violence, abuse, exploitation and trafficking. It established and operates Transit Accommodation Facilities on the key reception islands of Lesvos, Samos, Chios as well as in the urban centers of Athens, Greece.100% of the funding will directly go to METAdrasi 's Transit Accommodation Facilities that provide children with a safe, suitably-equipped space in accordance with their age. The specialized interdisciplinary groups (psychologists, social workers, special educators and nurses) and the support staff, along with the support of METAdrasi’s interpreters, offer children care, cover their everyday needs and provide psychological and social support, as well as health care and legal advice. The daily schedule of the children hosted is enriched with a variety of activities for their psychosocial development as well as  social, cultural, recreational and educational events that are organized in the facilities.CHILDREN SAFE AND SOUND WITH METAdrasiA unaccompanied child met by METAdrasi team members.METAdrasi Housing/AccomodationsA METAdrasi housing facility.A baby and children in their colorful, safe bedrooms.Drawings let children express their fears, hopes and desires with a METAdrasi team member.METAdrasi classroom.Sports and having fun with METAdrasi team members.During a joint project with university students. © Dimitris VoutsasA METAdrasi housing facility.When you put crayons, markers and pens in these children's hands, you have this!""GREECE SEA IS DANGEROUS BUT IT IS HOPE FOR BRIGHT FUTURE FOR US""*Drawn and written by one of the children.METAdrasi NEED FUNDS! Please support my fundraiser! Give now! These children have suffered more than we can imagine!Here is a breakdown of what the total funds of the fundraiser will do for METAdrasi:-$15,000.00 USD would cover the yearly rent for one of the facilities.-$10,000.00 USD would cover food costs of ALL the 4 accomodations for one month.-$1000.00 USD would cover the recreational activities expenses for 15 children per month. -$350.00 USD would cover the monthly medical and pharmaceutical expenses for 15 children.-All funding goes directly to METAdrasi, for the children to remain healthy in safe and clean accommodations. METAdrasi is a registered nonprofit organization so your donation is deductible to the extent of the law. For your records, METAdrasi's Tax ID number is 997777147.BACKGROUND/PRESSLora Pappa is the founder and President of METAdrasi. Her main interest during her career has been to focus on work relating to the reception and integration of refugees. Lora worked for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, the Council for Refugees and the National Youth Foundation. She designed the operation of the first Hospitality Center for unaccompanied minors in Crete and the Hospitality Center of Unaccompanied Girls and Single Family Families of Refugees in Athens. Through all her extensive experience in the field, Lora was aiming to find the best possible ways for consolidating efforts and facilitating life conditions of refugees, and, particularly, unaccompanied minors. In 2010 METAdrasi was born a NGO for action for migration and development.**Lora Pappa is the laureate of the 'Council of Europe North-South Prize', a distinction awarded annually, who stood out internationally for her role in defending human rights and democracy and for promoting dialogue, global interdependence and solidarity. ** Britain's 'Guardian Newspaper' highlights METAdrasi's champion work in instituting shelter for the unaccompanied refugee children.**A profile in 'Artnet' on Ai Weiwei the international artist who speaks of his experiences on the frontlines in Greece and how he created artworks from witnessing the migrant crisis first hand. He partially donated his proceeds to METAdrasi.**Mandy Patinkin, the actor, visits several of the METAdrasi housing facilities to hear the children's stories and to put a spotlight on their plight. LET'S JOIN THE CHILDREN AND SEND LOVE TO METAdrasi BY FUNDING THEIR HUMANITARIAN EFFORTS AND BECOME A HUMANITARIAN OURSELVES. IT IS GREAT TO GIVE! THANK YOU FOR ALL YOU DO!LOVE, STEPHANIE",38.0,1,"2 Campaigns

Human trafficking may sound like something that only happens in far-off places. But it happens right here, at home, every day. You may have passed a victim in the streets, on your way to work. Someone you know may have been trafficked. The following story is real. We have left out information in order to protect the identities of the victims and to avoid interfering with the prosecution of this particular case.
What we CAN tell you is heartbreaking.
Details:

The victims involved in this case were hard working Central Americans who wanted to provide a better life for their families. They were extorted by ""recruiters"" who promised to get them into the United States for lawful employment.
<ul>
• The traffickers required large sums of money for various fees related to obtaining their work visas.
• Once the exorbitant fees had been paid, the victims were told that their applications were lost, and the fees would need to be paid again.
• Once at the airport, the traffickers said that the airlines would not honor their tickets, and so the victims were forced to scrounge additional funds to buy a second set of tickets.
• Many of the victims had to mortgage their homes in order to cover these required costs.
After finally arriving in the United States, the victims were immediately put to work without being allowed to eat or rest.
<ul>
• Their living conditions were deplorable. As many as twelve victims were crammed into a single trailer. These trailers did not have working toilets or ventilation.
• The victims were not paid their promised wages, and what they did receive was well below the legal minimum.

• The money that they did earn was garnished by the traffickers to cover utility costs in excess of their earnings. This created the false idea that the victims were indebted to the traffickers for their living expenses.

• The traffickers told them that if they left, their visas would be revoked and that they would be tracked and arrested.  They were told that the sentence for a visa violation was 25 years, and they would be deported to serve their terms in their home countries.
These deceptions created an emotional prison that allowed the traffickers to exploit these individuals.
<ul>
• The victims were worried about their families back home, who were now indebted to local money lenders and were in danger of losing their property, which in some cases held three generations.
• They were not making enough money to support their families' financial needs.

Despite the mental and economic enslavement these workers faced, they found the courage to escape either singly or in small groups and are scattered across the United States. Several made their way to Pittsburgh.
What They Need:
The victims have no money and are unable to work legally at this time.  They need:
<ul>
• Shelter
• Food
• Clothes
• Medical care
• Transportation
• Legal representation
In addition, these people are in danger of losing their homes back in Central America.
How you can help:

We are raising $2000 for these trafficking victims to provide housing, food, clothing, transportation and also to make small interest payments on the lands they mortgaged.  This is an emergency stop-gap until government resources kick in and they are able to work. We will be helping at least four people, but we know there are many more victims and we are reaching out to them as well.  As other victims associated with this case turn up, the need for resources will likely increase.  All donations processed through PayPal are tax deductible.
Other Ways to Help:

Please forward this appeal to everyone you know.  Get the word out, we need your help.

A terrible injustice has been done, but we have the opportunity to make it right.
About Us:

Confere Inservitus is a nonprofit organization dedicated to confronting the causes and manifestations of human trafficking, slavery and severe forms of exploitation.  More information about Confere Inservitus is available at www.confereinservitus.org.

The Project to End Human Trafficking (www.endhumantrafficking.org) is a non-profit organization whose mission is to work toward the elimination of trafficking in persons, especially women and children trafficked for the purpose of sexual exploitation.

Campaign Pitch:

My name is Matthew Greenfield and I am a professional acrobat and circus instructor at Circus Warehouse based in New York City. Three months ago, Valiant pictures and I launched the “Love is Love Advocacy Video” in support of LGBT rights (
column3:
amp...). The main goal was to spark a fire within our viewers to join the fight against LGBT discrimination and push for more social progress to be made in the U.S. The video was a huge success! We spread our message about equal love to over 11,500 viewers and were featured in Instinct Magazine.  With such a positive response from the public, we have decided to continue our advocacy work and make another acrobatic film advocating for women’s rights. We hope to inspire others through our art to stand up to gender inequality and help protect equal rights for all people.

Even though professionals from the circus community are generously donating their time, we still need help covering costs to create this new advocacy video. Here is the break down of all our expenses, so you know exactly where your contribution is going:

Crew/Talent: $4,000

Equipment/Rental Space: $2,000

Post Production: $500

Total: $6,500

Thank you so much for considering to help this project come to life. We look forward to empowering women all over the world through artistic expression. 

Cast:

Suzi Winson - https://circuswarehouse.com/2015/03/suzi-winson/

Olga Karmanski - http://www.contortion-nyc.com

Anna Venizelos - https://circuswarehouse.com/2015/02/anna-venize...

Susan Voyticky - http://www.voyticky.com

La Cage Trio (Michelle Arvin, Summer Lacy, Sonja Hampstead) - http://www.lacagetrio.com 

Samantha Sterman - http://www.samanthasterman.com

PT

 

Em 2015, face à passagem da Caravana Feminista da Marcha Mundial das Mulheres pelo Porto, um conjunto de pessoas e coletivos juntaram-se para a organizar um Festival Feminista, que decorreu durante todo o mês de outubro. Dezenas de pessoas apresentaram propostas e houve mais de 60 iniciativas em mais de 20 espaços da cidade do Porto. Foi uma experiência tão positiva que decidimos continuar neste ano.

O festival surge da necessidade de gerar espaços comuns onde possamos partilhar e discutir problemáticas relacionadas às diferentes opressões de gênero, de maneira a visibiliza-las e trazê-las do privado para colectivo, do pessoal para o politico. Desta forma, podemos criar ferramentas para lutar contra formas de dominação que atravessam a nossa experiência quotidiana: no trabalho, nas relações pessoais e de intimidade, no uso do espaço público, no direito a decidir sobre os nossos corpos...

O tema do II Festival Feminista do Porto é RESISTÊNCIAS &
column4:
(re)EXISTÊNCIAS - Os feminismos nossos de cada dia e vai decorrer durante todo o mês de Março, para o qual lançamos um apelo a propostas. Recebemos mais de 70 propostas que incluem concertos, exposições, debates, workshops e performances. O Festival irá contar com a presença de cerca de 100 pessoas de Portugal e não só, com visões diversas dos feminismos, dispostas a partilhar e a debater ideias.

O Festival é totalmente autogerido e não depende de nenhum tipo de organização, mas sim do trabalho voluntário das organizadoras e da solidariedade entre espaços, coletivos e de todas as pessoas que o tornam possível. É nosso desejo apoiar todas as propostas, nomeadamente ao nível de alimentação, necessidades logísticas, viagens e alojamento. Nesse sentido, e tendo em conta as necessidades identificadas, elaborámos um orçamento com um valor global de 2000 euros, com as seguintes rubricas:

- Alimentação. (uma refeição por participante): €500

- Logística. (projetor, material de luz e som, material gráfico): 750€

- Viagens. €750

Assim, convidamos todas as pessoas/coletivos interessadas neste projeto a apoiar o Festival Feminista do Porto, através do processo de Crowdfunding. Ajuda-nos a divulgar este apelo e participa junta-te a nós!

ES

En 2015, debido al paso de la caravana feminista de la Marcha Mundial de las Mujeres en Oporto, un conjunto de personas y grupos se reunieron para organizar un Festival Feminista celebrado en la ciudad durante el mes de octubre. Decenas de personas presentaron propuestas y hubo más de 60 iniciativas en más de 20 zonas de la ciudad de Oporto. Fue una experiencia tan positiva que decidimos continuar.

El festival surge de la necesidad de generar espacios comunes donde podamos compartir y discutir problemáticas relacionadas con las diferentes opresiones de género, visibilizarlas y llevarlas de lo privado a lo colectivo, de lo personal a lo político. Creando así herramientas para luchar contra las diferentes formas de dominación que atraviesan nuestras experiencias cotidianas: en el trabajo, en las relaciones personales y de intimidad, en el uso del espacio público, en el derecho a decidir sobre nuestro propio cuerpo…

El tema del segundo Festival Feminista de Oporto es RESISTENCIAS &
column5:
(re)EXISTENCIAS - los feminismos nuestros de cada día y va a tener lugar a lo largo del mes de Marzo para el que realizamos una convocatoria abierta. Recibimos más de 70 propuestas que incluyen conciertos, exposiciones, debates, talleres y performances. El festival va a contar con la presencia de cerca de 100 personas de Portugal y fuera del país, con visiones diversas de los feminismos y su necesidad, dispuestas a compartir y discutir ideas.

El festival se organiza de forma completamente autogestionada y no depende de ningún tipo de organización, pero sí del trabajo voluntario de las organizadoras y la solidaridad entre espacios, colectivos y de todas las personas que lo hacen posible. Queremos apoyar a todas las personas que hicieron propuestas, concretamente con relación a alimentación, logística, transporte y alojamiento. En este sentido, y teniendo en cuenta las necesidades identificadas en el análisis de las propuestas, produjimos un presupuesto con un valor total de 2.000 euros, con las siguientes partidas de gastos:

 

- Alimentación. (una comida para cada participante) 500 €

- Logística. (proyector, material audiovisual, material gráfico): € 750

- Viajes. € 750 por mes.

 

Por lo tanto, invitamos a todas las personas/colectivos interesadas en este proyecto para apoyar el Festival Feminista do Porto, a través del proceso de Crowdfunding. Ayúdanos a difundir este llamado, participa y júntate a nosotr@s!

 

EN

In 2015, after the passage of the Feminist Caravan of the World March of Women through Porto, a group of people came together to organize a Feminist Festival in the city during the month of October. Dozens of people presented proposals which resulted in more than 60 events in over 20 spaces in the city of Porto. The experience was so positive that we decided to continue.

The festival emerges from the necessity to create public spaces that allow us to share the various problems of gender oppression - by visualizing them, they are taken from private to public, personal problems become political issues. This way we create tools to fight against different kinds of domination that we experience from day to day: at work, in personal relations and intimacy, public spaces, the right to decide about our own bodies...

The title of the 2nd Feminist Festival of Porto is RESISTENCES &
column6:
(re)EXISTENCES - Our feminisms of every day taking place in March 2017. We launched an open call for proposals and received 70 proposals that include concerts, exhibitions, debates, workshops and performances. During the festival about 100 people from all over the country and abroad, with diverse visions about feminisms, are ready to share and debate ideas, to build and rebuild initiatives and changes.

The entire festival is self-organized and independent of other organisations. But we do depend on voluntary work of the organizers and solidarity between spaces, collectives and all the persons who contribute to the success of the project. We would like to support those who made proposals in terms of food, logistics, travel costs and accommodation. After having identified the needs, we have prepared a budget with an overall value of 2000 euros, consisting of the following areas:

- Food. (one meal per participant): € 500

- Logistics. (projector, light and sound material, graphic material): € 750

- Travel costs. € 750

Thus, we invite all the people / groups interested in this project to support the Festival Feminista do Porto, through Crowdfunding or bank transfer.

Help us spread this appeal, participate and join us!

 

FR

 

En 2015, grâce au passage de la Caravane Féministe de l Marche Mondiale des Femmes à Porto, un groupe de personnes et collectifs se sont rassemblé pour organiser un Festival Féministe, qui a eu lieu pendant tout le mois d'octobre. Dizaines de personnes ont présenté des propositions et il y a eu plus de 60 initiatives en plus de 20 espaces de la ville de Porto. Ce fut une expérience tellement positive qu'on a décidé de continuer cette année.

Le festival naît du besoin de construire des espaces communs où nous pourrons partager et discuter des problématiques liées aux différentes oppressions de genre, de manière à les visibiliser et les emmener du privé au collectif, du personnel au politique. Ainsi, nous pourrons créer des outils pour luter contre des formes de domination qui traversent notre expérience quotidienne : dans le travail, dans les relations personnelles et d'intimité, dans l'utilisation de l'espace publique, dans le droit à décider sur nos corps...

Le thème du II Festival Féministe do Porto est RESISTANCES &
column7:
(re)EXISTANCES – les féminismes notre de chaque jour et il aura lieu pendant tout le mois de mars de 2017, pour lequel nous avons lancé un appel à propositions. Nous avons reçu plus de 70 propositions dont des concerts, des expositions, des débats, des ateliers et des performances. Le Festival recevra environ 100 personnes du Portugal et pas seulement, avec des différents visions du féminisme, qui on l'envie de partager et débattre des idées.

Le Festival est totalement auto-géré et ne dépend pas d'aucune organisation, mais du travail bénévole des organisatrices et de la solidarité entre des espaces, des colectifs et de toutes le personnes qui le rendent possible. Nous voulons soutenir toutes les propostions, nottament au niveau de l'alimentation, des besoins logistiques, des voyages et de l’hébergement. Dans ce sens, et après l'évaluation des besoins, nous avons fait un budget de 2000€ , avec les rubriques suivantes :

-Aimentation. (1 repas par participant.e) : 500€

-Logistique. (projecteur, matériel de lumiére et son, matériel graphique) : 750€

-Voyages. 750€

 

Nous intitons ainsi toutes les personnes/collectifs intéressés dans ce projet à soutenir le Festival Féministe de Porto, avec ce vous pouvez ou en diffusant la campagne. Aide-nous à difuser cet appel et rejoins nous en mars !

É nosso desejo apoiar todas as propostas, nomeadamente ao nível de alimentação, necessidades logísticas, viagens e alojamento. Nesse sentido, e tendo em conta as necessidades identificadas, elaborámos um orçamento com um valor global de 2000 euros, com as seguintes rubricas:- Alimentação. (uma refeição por participante): €500- Logística. (projetor, material de luz e som, material gráfico): 750€- Viagens. €750Assim, convidamos todas as pessoas/coletivos interessadas neste projeto a apoiar o Festival Feminista do Porto, através do processo de Crowdfunding. Ajuda-nos a divulgar este apelo e participa junta-te a nós!ESEn 2015, debido al paso de la caravana feminista de la Marcha Mundial de las Mujeres en Oporto, un conjunto de personas y grupos se reunieron para organizar un Festival Feminista celebrado en la ciudad durante el mes de octubre. Decenas de personas presentaron propuestas y hubo más de 60 iniciativas en más de 20 zonas de la ciudad de Oporto. Fue una experiencia tan positiva que decidimos continuar.El festival surge de la necesidad de generar espacios comunes donde podamos compartir y discutir problemáticas relacionadas con las diferentes opresiones de género, visibilizarlas y llevarlas de lo privado a lo colectivo, de lo personal a lo político. Creando así herramientas para luchar contra las diferentes formas de dominación que atraviesan nuestras experiencias cotidianas: en el trabajo, en las relaciones personales y de intimidad, en el uso del espacio público, en el derecho a decidir sobre nuestro propio cuerpo…El tema del segundo Festival Feminista de Oporto es RESISTENCIAS & (re)EXISTENCIAS - los feminismos nuestros de cada día y va a tener lugar a lo largo del mes de Marzo para el que realizamos una convocatoria abierta. Recibimos más de 70 propuestas que incluyen conciertos, exposiciones, debates, talleres y performances. El festival va a contar con la presencia de cerca de 100 personas de Portugal y fuera del país, con visiones diversas de los feminismos y su necesidad, dispuestas a compartir y discutir ideas.El festival se organiza de forma completamente autogestionada y no depende de ningún tipo de organización, pero sí del trabajo voluntario de las organizadoras y la solidaridad entre espacios, colectivos y de todas las personas que lo hacen posible. Queremos apoyar a todas las personas que hicieron propuestas, concretamente con relación a alimentación, logística, transporte y alojamiento. En este sentido, y teniendo en cuenta las necesidades identificadas en el análisis de las propuestas, produjimos un presupuesto con un valor total de 2.000 euros, con las siguientes partidas de gastos: - Alimentación. (una comida para cada participante) 500 €- Logística. (proyector, material audiovisual, material gráfico): € 750- Viajes. € 750 por mes. Por lo tanto, invitamos a todas las personas/colectivos interesadas en este proyecto para apoyar el Festival Feminista do Porto, a través del proceso de Crowdfunding. Ayúdanos a difundir este llamado, participa y júntate a nosotr@s! ENIn 2015, after the passage of the Feminist Caravan of the World March of Women through Porto, a group of people came together to organize a Feminist Festival in the city during the month of October. Dozens of people presented proposals which resulted in more than 60 events in over 20 spaces in the city of Porto. The experience was so positive that we decided to continue.The festival emerges from the necessity to create public spaces that allow us to share the various problems of gender oppression - by visualizing them, they are taken from private to public, personal problems become political issues. This way we create tools to fight against different kinds of domination that we experience from day to day: at work, in personal relations and intimacy, public spaces, the right to decide about our own bodies...The title of the 2nd Feminist Festival of Porto is RESISTENCES & (re)EXISTENCES - Our feminisms of every day taking place in March 2017. We launched an open call for proposals and received 70 proposals that include concerts, exhibitions, debates, workshops and performances. During the festival about 100 people from all over the country and abroad, with diverse visions about feminisms, are ready to share and debate ideas, to build and rebuild initiatives and changes.The entire festival is self-organized and independent of other organisations. But we do depend on voluntary work of the organizers and solidarity between spaces, collectives and all the persons who contribute to the success of the project. We would like to support those who made proposals in terms of food, logistics, travel costs and accommodation. After having identified the needs, we have prepared a budget with an overall value of 2000 euros, consisting of the following areas:- Food. (one meal per participant): € 500- Logistics. (projector, light and sound material, graphic material): € 750- Travel costs. € 750Thus, we invite all the people / groups interested in this project to support the Festival Feminista do Porto, through Crowdfunding or bank transfer.Help us spread this appeal, participate and join us! FR En 2015, grâce au passage de la Caravane Féministe de l Marche Mondiale des Femmes à Porto, un groupe de personnes et collectifs se sont rassemblé pour organiser un Festival Féministe, qui a eu lieu pendant tout le mois d'octobre. Dizaines de personnes ont présenté des propositions et il y a eu plus de 60 initiatives en plus de 20 espaces de la ville de Porto. Ce fut une expérience tellement positive qu'on a décidé de continuer cette année.Le festival naît du besoin de construire des espaces communs où nous pourrons partager et discuter des problématiques liées aux différentes oppressions de genre, de manière à les visibiliser et les emmener du privé au collectif, du personnel au politique. Ainsi, nous pourrons créer des outils pour luter contre des formes de domination qui traversent notre expérience quotidienne : dans le travail, dans les relations personnelles et d'intimité, dans l'utilisation de l'espace publique, dans le droit à décider sur nos corps...Le thème du II Festival Féministe do Porto est RESISTANCES & (re)EXISTANCES – les féminismes notre de chaque jour et il aura lieu pendant tout le mois de mars de 2017, pour lequel nous avons lancé un appel à propositions. Nous avons reçu plus de 70 propositions dont des concerts, des expositions, des débats, des ateliers et des performances. Le Festival recevra environ 100 personnes du Portugal et pas seulement, avec des différents visions du féminisme, qui on l'envie de partager et débattre des idées.Le Festival est totalement auto-géré et ne dépend pas d'aucune organisation, mais du travail bénévole des organisatrices et de la solidarité entre des espaces, des colectifs et de toutes le personnes qui le rendent possible. Nous voulons soutenir toutes les propostions, nottament au niveau de l'alimentation, des besoins logistiques, des voyages et de l’hébergement. Dans ce sens, et après l'évaluation des besoins, nous avons fait un budget de 2000€ , avec les rubriques suivantes :-Aimentation. (1 repas par participant.e) : 500€-Logistique. (projecteur, matériel de lumiére et son, matériel graphique) : 750€-Voyages. 750€ Nous intitons ainsi toutes les personnes/collectifs intéressés dans ce projet à soutenir le Festival Féministe de Porto, avec ce vous pouvez ou en diffusant la campagne. Aide-nous à difuser cet appel et rejoins nous en mars !",2.0,1,"1 Campaign

We Did It! We Raised $25,000+ For the Bookstore About the World, For a Radically Different World 
To All of You Who Made It Possible...A HEARTFELT THANKS

On Wednesday night at 9:30pm, the Revolution Books Indiegogo Fund Drive met its $25,000 goal (and by the final deadline of 3am, an additional $885 was donated). This is a tremendous thing. More than 300 of us--many individuals and several groups of people--contributed so that RB can not only survive but thrive.

To the donors and participants in the drive who have been part of the Revolution Books community, a warm thanks. To those who gave and participated and are new to the RB community: welcome and our warm thanks. 

You are part of a community of donors and supporters that includes prominent authors and scholars
column3: artists, professors, lawyers, teachers, and other professionals
column6: and so many others. Some of you were part of matching challenges
column7:
some of you came to the wine-tasting benefit hosted by the Pompette Wine Shop. Some of you spread the word on social media, including in Mexico. A 10-year old neighbor of RB sold his used books, and was joined by other children in the neighborhood. Several immigrants made a group donation and issued a powerful statemeht calling on people to support a bookstore that “tells the truth about how people live and the revolution to emancipate humanity.”

RB is a precious resource. At RB you can dig into why humanity faces this fascist Trump-Pence monstrosity. Here you discover that a radically different and better world is possible--and engage the strategy to get to a new world, and a more scientific method and approach for understanding and changing the world, all of which is in the New Communism developed by Bob Avakian. At RB people get into the biggest questions confronting humanity…and on that foundation of knowing and changing the world, RB opens up discovery of an incredible range of literature, science, and scholarship.

The $25,885 raised will go towards a vibrant promotion campaign—so 1000s more can find out about and make RB a destination, and for hundreds of new titles that speak to the urgent  issues of our times, and for Spanish-language, children’s literature and more. 

Go to www.revolutionbooksnyc.org&
column9:
to find out about our exciting, upcoming programs and events. Consider becoming a monthly SUSTAINER of RB. And come visit us at the store in Harlem!

THANKS AGAIN FOR MAKING THIS VICTORY POSSIBLE.

* * *

REVOLUTION BOOKS SUMMER 2017 FUND DRIVE
Support the Bookstore About the World…
and For a Radically Different World
A Bookstore That Changes Lives

There is no place else, none that plays the role that Revolution Books does.

If you have spent any time at RB you experienced what we say about the store: that people come to Revolution Books from all over the world and around the corner -- from the projects to the brownstones of Harlem -- to find the books and the deep engagement with each other about why the world is the way it is and the possibility of radically different way the world could be. How much does that matter at a moment when the Trump/Pence fascist regime threatens the seven billion people on the planet, and the planet itself?

Every dollar you donate to Revolution Books opens up possibility: for children to discover books with humane values, for young people to grapple with the big questions of our time, for people of all ages and nationalities from ex-prisoners to college professors -- to know, grapple with, and be a part of changing the world. This can be life changing.  But it only happens with your financial support.

Curiosity about everything, discovery of different cultures, learning of lives of peoples hidden from view, and the stories of history suppressed course through Revolution Books. Here you feel the vibe of certitude about the potential for a better world and a deep critique and intolerance for the unnecessary suffering of people. Authors, artists, and customers comment that programs or just hanging out here is different, richer -- an engagement filled with a thirst for what is true.

RB spokesperson, Andy Zee, with Pulitzer Prize-winning author Heather Ann Thompson (Blood in the Water:  The Attica Prison Uprising of 1971 and Its Legacy) at RB in January .

This vitality stems from the breakthrough in revolutionary theory that is the new communism developed by the revolutionary leader Bob Avakian. Most of all, this is a more scientific method and approach to understanding the world as it actually is. The passion for changing the world at RB comes from his vision and the strategy for an actual revolution and a radically new society on the road to real emancipation.

column1: <div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/m9KWayYC1L4?autohide=1&amp
column3:
showinfo=0"">
 

More than a bookstore, Revolution Books is the political, intellectual, and cultural Center of a movement for revolution. Important Books. Pulitzer and Grammy award winners mixing it up with youth and ex-prisoners. Scholars and writers engaging with spokesperson Andy Zee and other revolutionary thinkers and fighters. RB is a place of radical and revolutionary ferment. A place that hosts a culture of revolt against a revolting culture.

For all of this, your support is essential. Your contribution makes it possible for the new Revolution Books in Harlem to be viable and thrive.

This can't happen on the sale of books alone, especially when so many still don't know about the new RB in Harlem. Your contribution this year will go to a vibrant promotion campaign so that many more people learn about and make our RB a destination. This is crucial to getting the store on a sustainable path.

RB has an important curated collection of thousands of books... but more titles are needed to serve the wide scope of our global mission and as part of making RB viable.

Without you, RB cannot meet the needs of today. But with your generous contribution, Revolution Books will meet that need with the books, the engagement, and the understanding to forge a culture, a people, and a movement for a whole new world.

TOGETHER, WE CAN WIN THE REVOLUTION BOOKS FUND DRIVE --
$25,000 BY AUGUST 2

* * *
NEWS: Journalist and author HERB BOYD (Baldwin in Harlem, Black Detroit) speaks on C-SPAN Book TV about Revolution Books and the history of independent bookstores in Harlem.
column179:
* * *

At a time when a fascist regime has come to power in the U.S. and is bent on a horrific course for humanity and the planet…Revolution Books has to be much more widely known and have far greater impact.

column1:
$25,000 by August 2!
* For promotion and publicity to let the world know
* For more books that matter
...to take Revolution Books to a whole new level of impact
RB can’t survive and rise to this urgent moment without YOU. Donate now.

column2:
>
Watching RevBooks' Indiegogo video on Sunday afternoon in the bookstore

column1: RB is a unique and vibrant space: a bookstore that is the political, intellectual, and cultural center of a movement for revolution. This summer Revolution Books launches its third annual crowd-funding campaign. RB must expand its reach and base of support at a time when this bookstore matters more than ever.
<ul><li>

From an NGO consultant:
""...This fund drive for Revolution Books is not just a ""feel-good"" moment but an absolute imperative for anyone who sees what is going on in this country and around the world and who desperately wants to learn more, do more, have more of an actual impact ...""
To read the whole statement, go here: http://www.revolutionbooksnyc.org/NGOstatement.htm
<h3 style=""margin-left:40px
column2: >""At Revolution Books the lights are holding steady and people are talking...""

>--so wrote LitHub on Nov 30, 2016... ""There was a time when it wasn’t so peculiar to believe that a new world order might be launched from a bookstore. In Harlem, on the stretch of Lenox Avenue also known as Malcolm X Boulevard, across the street from St. John’s Pentecostal and two doors down from the House of Seafood, that time persists—at least inside Revolution Books, which is either a throwback to a bygone era or the vanguard of a strikingly new one, depending on whom you ask and whether a bigoted oligarch has recently been elected to serve as President of the United States. On that latter subject, the signs propped up on the sidewalk and hanging in the front window make the store’s position fairly clear: “Mein Trumpf: A Thoroughly American Fascist Pig!” declares one, with a graphic mashup of Trump, Hitler and a Klansman. Another: “In the Name of Humanity We REFUSE to Accept a Fascist America”... Read whole article here

column1: * Parents bring their kids to discover books that promote values of cooperation, appreciation for diversity, and the ability to learn about the world and make it better. One Saturday morning program taught young children about evolution.

* A high school intern on his first day says he doesn’t know much about the world and wants to learn. He talks to RB staff, finds the book Enrique's Journey about children from Central America who travel to the US on top of trains
column2: he observes: “People are forced to escape to America because of what it does to their countries, but when they come, America  doesn’t want them.”

column1: * Professors and Harlem neighbors come to find the new scholarship on slavery and the true history of Black people in the US
column2: high school and college students come to explore and debate the causes of women’s oppression and how that oppression can be overcome.

column1: <h2 style=""text-align: center
column2: >Revolution Books can change more lives -- with your donation today.

><i>""...When an HIV awareness event I was planning could no longer be accommodated at our first venue, Rev Books became a home for the event. I'm thankful and pleased that Revolution Books has a place in our community. It's more than a bookstore
column3:
it's a panel discussion on Mondays, or an open mic night on Fridays. Its purpose morphs and serves our neighborhood and its people as a hub for exploration and knowledge. 
-- Marvin, works at Harlem social service organization

column1: MISSION: THE EMANCIPATION OF HUMANITY…

This is a place where people of all ages find the books and discussion with each other about why the world is the way it is, and how it could be transformed in the interests of the people of the world. At RB, revolution is the foundation for the rich engagement with the world of ideas. Rev Books features incredible books: fiction, history, art, philosophy, science, memoir, revolutionary theory... children’s literature.

column2:
>Carl Dix, RB spokesperson Andy Zee and Dr. Cornel West, October 2016,
at the launch of Bob Avakian's book The New Communism

column1: At RB, people discover and can take up a truly scientific approach to the problems confronting the 7 billion on this planet, and the way out of the madness--the new synthesis of communism developed by Bob Avakian—and the leadership he is giving to the revolution to emancipate humanity. Watch BA here.
Donate now to make RB more widely known and visited.
A GREAT BEGINNING, NOVEMBER 2015…

We converted a former beauty parlor into a beautiful bookstore and performance space. A local architect donated the design. Students and neighborhood people helped spackle and paint. Intellectuals, people in the book world, and neighborhood activists fed in ideas and helped spread the word. People from different walks of life and raised the funds to acquire new books and make the initial renovations.

column2: >Sunsara Taylor and Dr. Willie Parker, one of the last abortion doctors in the South at Revolution Books on June 4, 2017 (Photo: Ronald Dennis)

column1: REVOLUTION BOOKS IS MAKING A REAL DIFFERENCE.

Since opening, RB has hosted dozens of author programs and cultural events. Two 2017  Pulitzer Prize winners, novelist Colson Whitehead (Underground Railroad) and historian Heather Ann Thompson (Blood in the Water on the Attica rebellion), have appeared in conversation with RB spokesperson Andy Zee.

Programs on mass incarceration have gotten into how America’s history of white supremacy and current political economy have produced this situation. A scientist/author who spoke at RB was asked: “What would be the ideal way for science to be taught and conducted in a just society?” The Revolution Club’s “Future People” open-mic nights have become a platform for music, spoken word, poetry -- and for discussion over what young people’s lives should be about.
The possibility of a radically different world opens up at RB
column2: the fiction, poetry, plays and performance reveal the soaring heights of human achievement
column3: and there is stimulating discussion, sharp and often jolting debate that challenges preconceptions. But it’s more than that. People who experience and are part of the life of RB—they go back out into the world. They influence and challenge others … and some become part of the movement for revolution. Yes, Revolution Books changes lives.

column2:
>Benefit Concert with Grammy-award winner Arturo O'Farrill in December 2016,
on RB's new performance stage, funded by last year's Indiegogo campaign.

column1: AT THIS DANGEROUS TIME, RB MATTERS EVEN MORE.

When Donald Trump came to power, RB swung into action with “65 Defiant Days of Talks, Culture, and Dialogue: In the Name of Humanity, We Refuse to Accept a Fascist America.”  We’ve continued to hold programs on and debated the roots of fascism in America, the lessons of history, and the kind of movement and struggle necessary to stop it.

Where else but at Revolution Books? Donate now.

Revolution Books is a not-for-profit bookstore with an all-volunteer staff.

column2: >At a recent Future People Open-Mic at Revolution Books

>At a moment of peril for humanity and the world, RB is providing a forum for addressing the specific crisis facing humanity, with the rise of a fascist regime in America and with repression, displacement and proxy wars sweeping across the world. Come to Revolution Books to find the questions being asked and debated and the scientific means being put forward for answering them. We all need to help make sure – right now – that Revolution Books will be there when it is most needed. 
– International human development consultant, Brooklyn

>""Revolution Books is a magical place.  A treasure of radical thinking, dreaming and planning.""  -- Award-winning playwright Naomi Wallace
Naomi Wallace and Bruce McLeod recently donated $500 to the Revolution Books Education Fund (RBEF). 
FYI:  If you want to make a tax-deductible donation, go to Revolution Books Education Fund a 501(c)3 entity which sponsors RB events.

column1:
* * *
The discourse and engagement at Revolution Books involve people from around the world, and from around the corner. People are coming to Harlem because of RB -- and people in Harlem are learning about the world and the potential for a real revolution because of RB.

BUT WE ARE AT A CROSSROADS.
YOUR DONATION MAKES A DIFFERENCE:

* We need thousands more people coming to the store, buying books, attending our programs and donating—in order to generate revenue to pay our rent and expand our selection. But that potential customer base doesn’t yet know about the store! Your contribution will enable us to publicize and promote RB, buy advertising including in social media, and improve our signage.

* When the thousands come, they need to find hundreds more of the books that open pathways to understanding the past and present, the possibilities of the future, and the yearnings of humanity. Your contribution will fund the purchase of books about the global refugee crisis, Spanish-language, new African fiction, children’s literature, and more.

$25,000 by August 2!
* For promotion and publicity to let the world know
* For more books that matter
...to take Revolution Books to a whole new level of impact

Donate and participate.
BECAUSE RB CHANGES LIVES.
BECAUSE WITHOUT RB THE WORLD STAYS AS IT IS.   

* * *
PERKS
$25 - Red Star enamel pin. Donated by Peoples Pins, Everitt, WA.  3/4"" wide
$50 - Revolution Books mug
$50 - RB mug with Dancer from Red Detachment of Women  ballet
$75- RB heavy red canvas tote bag

NEW!  $75- Yusef Salaam's new book of poetry, ""Words of a Man: My Right To Be."" We have 5 signed copies from the Yusef's book release party at Revolution Books. Yusef was one of the Central Park 5-- Black youth 14-16 years old who were framed up for the rape of a jogger and spent years in prison before being exonerated. Hard-to-get paperback.
$75 - Color poster from a benefit concert for Revolution Books with Afro-jazz great Arturo O'Farrill and his ensemble. 8.5""x11""
NEW! $75- Novel ""Here Comes the Sun,"" signed by the author Nicole Dennis-Benn during her evening at Revolution Books, July 7, 2017.  Paperback. Story of 3 women living in Montego Bay, Jamaica.

NEW!! - $75  Voucher good for 1 Homemade Pie donated by ""Fancy Pies: A Seasonal Pop-Up Pie Shop"" in Washington Heights. ""Just Peachy,"" ""Dave's Mixed Berry,"" and on and on. Take a look:  https://twitter.com/fancy_pies?lang=en

$100 - 2017 Hardback, signed by James Forman Jr. when he spoke at RB in June. A New York Times Book Review Editors' Choice, on how so many Black judges, prosecutors, politicians ended up ""locking up our own.""

NEW!   $100 -  Book by Professor Cheryl Wall, ""Women of the Harlem Renaissance,"" This hard-to-get acclaimed history was signed by the author during her evening at Revolution Books in June 2017. Watch here: vimeo.com/222786509

$150 - Bob Avakian Essentials.  Books by Bob Avakian: The New Communism and BAsics. Book by Ardea Skybreak: Science and Revolution. 
Includes Pin: ""There is no app for critical thinking."" -- Bob Avakian

NEW!  $150  - ""Life + Debt"" DVD, Collector's edition. Acclaimed documentary on imperialism, Test-case: Jamaica.  Directed by Stephanie Black who donated 3 copies. Narration by Jamaica Kincard, music by Mutabaruka. ""Powerful. Offers the clearest analysis of  globalization and its negative effects that I have ever seen."" -- Stephen Holden, NY Times

NEW! $200 - Amazing Dinner for 2, donated by Harlem Bar-B-Q, 547 Malcolm X Blvd. Specializes in ribs, wings, frozen margaritas!  ""Harlem Bar-B-Q believes in giving back to our community so that we all may move forward together. We support Revolution Books for being a staple bookstore in Harlem and a valuable resource for future generations to come.""

NEW!  $250 - Just published (July 2017) hardcover book: Conversations with Edwidge Danticat, edited by Maxine Lavon Montgomery, Literary Conversations Series, University Press of Mississippi. Includes interviews with the acclaimed Haitian novelist and essayist, ranging from 2000 (on Breath, Eyes, Memory) to a previously unpublished 2016 interview which offers insight into her life, art, and politics.

$500 - Rare poster of famous Chinese peasant painting from Huhsien County, revolutionary China circa 1973. This poster was brought back from China at that time, and recently donated to Revolution Books.  20"" x 30""

$750 - Screen Print by Shepard Fairey, in collaboration with Glen E. Friedman who took the photograph of Cornel West at the first dialogue between Dr. West and Carl Dix in July 2009. Edition of 450. Rare. Donated to RB by Shepard Fairey and Glen E. Friedman, signed by both artists + Dr. West.  18"" x 24″

NEW!  - $1500  Wooden carving of a young woman, with beads, Ivory Coast circa 1970.
Created by master carver from Atsei tribe. Carving of young woman, with beads at waist. Used in initiation ceremony for young woman going from puberty to adult. The figure's arms move forward and back.  Donated by a Harlem collector. 12"" x 4.5""
