Who We Are

The Montgomery County Anti-Human Trafficking Coalition (MCAT) is comprised of community members and area professionals invested in abolishing human trafficking. Started in 2011, MCAT works to fight human trafficking through our various committees. We have three main areas of focus:

  • Awareness:
column5: >To educate community members, area professionals, and services providers in recognizing potential trafficking victims, places of business where trafficking may occur, and the deceptive tactics of traffickers looking for victims. We also aim to equip community members, professionals, and service providers with what to do if they suspect that human trafficking is occurring.

column1: <li><span style=""color: black
column5: >Advocacy: To support training of law enforcement in recognizing potential trafficking victims and intervene with strengths based approach, using best practices.  We promote advocacy at local, state, and federal levels for policies supporting anti-human trafficking legislation.

column1: <li><span style=""color: black
column5: >Aftercare: To update and provide a network of contact information to connect community members, area professional, and services providers to organizations that help restore lives of those trafficked.

column1:
The Need

All of our committee members volunteer their time to be a part of MCAT and to bring light to the issue of human trafficking. In order for us to continue to raise awareness, provide training, and to accomplish all the cool things we have planned for 2015, we need your help. We are trying to raise a total of $5,000, which would fund:

  • Educational materials for community events
  • Our 501(c)3 nonprofit application
  • Costs of awareness events (we are planning at least 4 events in 2015)
• Guest speakers

And January is Human Trafficking Awareness Month, but we need your help to spread the word! 

The Impact

MCAT works to provide awareness in a number of ways and provide community members opportunities in which they can become active in helping eradicate human trafficking in Montgomery County. But Montgomery County community members can't partner with us if they aren't aware of the issue of human trafficking and the need for volunteers.
Awareness doesn't always create change, but you can't create change without awareness.
Even if you can't financially contribute, that doesn't mean they can't help! Here are a few ways you can get involved if you can't give:
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Like our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/mcatpa) and follow us on Twitter (@MCAT1PA)

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Sign up for our email list to stay in the know

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Attend one of our upcoming community events (to be announced)

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial

And there are many other ways you can get involved in fighting human trafficking in Montgomery County! Contact us at mcat1pa@gmail.com if you are interested in getting more involved or have any questions.

Thank you for your support! This is our first fundraiser, and we are excited for you to partner with us on this venture! 
","Who We Are The Montgomery County Anti-Human Trafficking Coalition (MCAT) is comprised of community members and area professionals invested in abolishing human trafficking. Started in 2011, MCAT works to fight human trafficking through our various committees. We have three main areas of focus: Awareness: To educate community members, area professionals, and services providers in recognizing potential trafficking victims, places of business where trafficking may occur, and the deceptive tactics of traffickers looking for victims. We also aim to equip community members, professionals, and service providers with what to do if they suspect that human trafficking is occurring.

Advocacy: To support training of law enforcement in recognizing potential trafficking victims and intervene with strengths based approach, using best practices.  We promote advocacy at local, state, and federal levels for policies supporting anti-human trafficking legislation.
Aftercare: To update and provide a network of contact information to connect community members, area professional, and services providers to organizations that help restore lives of those trafficked.

The Need All of our committee members volunteer their time to be a part of MCAT and to bring light to the issue of human trafficking. In order for us to continue to raise awareness, provide training, and to accomplish all the cool things we have planned for 2015, we need your help. We are trying to raise a total of $5,000, which would fund:  Educational materials for community events Our 501(c)3 nonprofit application Costs of awareness events (we are planning at least 4 events in 2015)
Guest speakers

And January is Human Trafficking Awareness Month, but we need your help to spread the word!    The Impact MCAT works to provide awareness in a number of ways and provide community members opportunities in which they can become active in helping eradicate human trafficking in Montgomery County. But Montgomery County community members can't partner with us if they aren't aware of the issue of human trafficking and the need for volunteers.
Awareness doesn't always create change, but you can't create change without awareness.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't financially contribute, that doesn't mean they can't help! Here are a few ways you can get involved if you can't give:  Spread the word about our campaign!
Like our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/mcatpa) and follow us on Twitter (@MCAT1PA)
Sign up for our email list to stay in the know
Attend one of our upcoming community events (to be announced)
Consider volunteering with MCAT (http://mcatpa.org/give/our-team-partners/volunteer-descriptions/)

And there are many other ways you can get involved in fighting human trafficking in Montgomery County! Contact us at mcat1pa@gmail.com if you are interested in getting more involved or have any questions.
Thank you for your support! This is our first fundraiser, and we are excited for you to partner with us on this venture!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column4: looking to partake in the freedom to bear arms for sport, recreation and personal protection while that freedom is still being afforded to us in this country.

Girls will get to participate in team building sessions, rock wall climbing, horse back riding, LIVE concerts, archery and a host of other fun activities! Our camps will host amazing artists and speakers and fun activities such as
makeovers, goal setting, vision casting, and pajama parties! It will also be focused on leaders of that region and preparing them
to inspire and love their generation!

Our West Coast Camp will be held this year in Sacramento, CA  December 5th – 7th, 2014 and our East Coast Camp will be held at Camp Grace in Roberta GA. We would be honored to have your support for girls to be trained in leadership to reach their  local
community!
All of the funds will go to provide transportation for the girls to get to camp, lodging, camp programming, meals and activities. We would like to provide 100 scholarships for girls to attend!
Your support will help ensure the success of our West Coast and East Coast events!
Please visit our website at
www.glamcampforgirls.org. to find out more information on the lives we are impacting or visit us on social media.
Twitter: @glamcamp4girls

","Did you know that  In the last several years, a local FBI task force recovered over 400 girls being sold for sex?  The youngest was eleven years old.  However, due to the fact that this is such a hidden crime, this number grossly understates the size and scope of the problem.  In addition, teen pregnancy is on the rise and cyber bullying among girls is ever increasing.
These issues are pressing and we won't stay silent!
We believe that girls can empower other girls by leading with LOVE and compassion. We host G.L.A.M. Camp events across the country to empower girls to BE THE CHANGE that's so desperately needed.

G.L.A.M Camp for Girls, Inc. is a not-for-profit  3 and 4-day event for junior high and high school girls who want to ROCK their communities for CHANGE!  We are a mentoring and leadership camp that empowers girls and promotes multiculturalism through many different artistic and creative means.  We strive to gather girls from all ethnicities, socio and economic backgrounds so that they can come together to make a difference in their communities.  They can impact their generation and BE THE CHANGE by leading with LOVE and compassion.  Our camp takes place in different cities across the United States.
If there is a girl in your life who fits this criteria, a leader, loves her community and wants to make a change, G.L.A.M. CAMP is for her!
BUT WE NEED YOU!  WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE IT ALL HAPPEN!
We don't want to turn girls away! We need your help to make camp happen at minimal cost or even FREE for girls who desire to attend!
Girls attending camp will leave empowered and confident! The camp addresses God-confidence, self-esteem, leadership, discovering true identity, how to gain
freedom from peer pressure, how to write out and complete life goals and action steps toward them, how to make healthy choices in
life, spiritual development and so much more!

Girls will get to participate in team building sessions, rock wall climbing, horse back riding, LIVE concerts, archery and a host of other fun activities! Our camps will host amazing artists and speakers and fun activities such as
makeovers, goal setting, vision casting, and pajama parties! It will also be focused on leaders of that region and preparing them
to inspire and love their generation!

Our West Coast Camp will be held this year in Sacramento, CA  December 5th – 7th, 2014 and our East Coast Camp will be held at Camp Grace in Roberta GA. We would be honored to have your support for girls to be trained in leadership to reach their  local
community!
All of the funds will go to provide transportation for the girls to get to camp, lodging, camp programming, meals and activities. We would like to provide 100 scholarships for girls to attend!
Your support will help ensure the success of our West Coast and East Coast events!
Please visit our website at
www.glamcampforgirls.org. to find out more information on the lives we are impacting or visit us on social media.
Twitter: @glamcamp4girls
Instagram: @glamcampforgirls
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/DGGGlamcamp

Other Ways that YOU Can Help Girls get to  GLAM Camp! We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this empowerment campaign!  You can do this by using one  of your social media outlets, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to encourage people to check out our movement and what we are doing with young girls.

Please share this campaign with 3 people:  someone who might want to volunteer, someone who has a heart for seeing young girls as visionaries and might want to give a financial gift and a young girl who who could use this camp experience.  We want to be the change we are seeking in this generation and we believe LOVE is the anecdote for change!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Call for
Humanitarian Aid: A Human Tragedy on our shores.
The refugee crisis is on OUR shores.
Here at the Archipelagos Institute of Marine conservation we are asking YOU to
help us help those desperately seeking safety. THOUSANDS of refugees are
arriving on the Eastern Aegean Islands EVERY DAY. They arrive exhausted having
left behind all their worldly belongings. Witnessing the fear and vulnerability
of these men, women and children has compelled us to try and provide basic
amenities to these people with the few supplies we have. The refugee crisis
worsens every day and we fear a hard winter is ahead of them, we need to do
more. Will you help us help them?
What will my money be used for?
Our priority is to provide refugees who
reach the shores of Samos and Agathonisi islands with basic amenities including
water, food, nappies, baby milk, clothes, shoes and medication, with priority
given to those who are most vulnerable, namely children, women and the elderly.
However if we receive sufficient donations we will be able to purchase
additional supplies such as sleeping bags, tents and waterproof jackets to make
the rough journey to Northern Europe they have ahead of them easier. 100% of
donations will go straight into buying products and providing services to make
the lives of the refugees better and bring smiles to the faces of those most in
need. For transparency we will be publishing invoices of EVERYTHING we buy with
YOUR donations so you can know how YOU made a DIFFERENCE.
EVERY LITTLE COUNTS! €1 = 4 litres of
water. €5 = 10 boxes of biscuits. €10 = 1 packet of nappies/diapers. €50 = 1
week of provisions for 1 person. €100 = 7 sleeping bags or 10 waterproof
jackets. Please give anything you can.
Who are Archipelagos?
Archipelagos Institute of Marine Conservation (http://archipelago.gr/) is
a non-profit organisation based on 6 islands in the Eastern Aegean Sea. We are made
up of a dynamic group of researchers, scientists, students and volunteers from all
over the world working in environmental conservation of the Greek Seas and the
NE Mediterranean.
Although Archipelagos has not previously been involved in humanitarian work, we
have felt compelled to help in this crisis happening next to us. So far we have
utilised personal funds from the team to help provide the many refugees coming
into the Eastern Aegean islands with basic supplies. We need to do a lot more,
but we need your help.

Türkçe için sayfanın en altına inin. (Scroll down for Turkish.)

Istanbul LGBTI+ Pride Week celebrates its 25th anniversary!

Istanbul Pride Week, organised with the collective efforts of volunteers, who gather with open calls will take place this year 19-25 June 2017.

Istanbul Pride has brought up various themes including “Beware of the Family!”, “Taboo”, “Memory”, “Contact”, “Normal?” and “We Unite!” in the last years. Once again this year, in addition to the the forums, panel discussions and events addressing issues such as health, visibility, and constitutional rights central to agenda of the LGBTI+ movement, we will also discuss how we can build a political sense of solidarity and how we can find alternative ways to achieve this, despite the state of emergency and oppression becoming more of a menace every single day.

To reach out each other, to heal our wounds, and to talk about our experiences, bodies, and emotions, we will come together at workshops, and we will celebrate our solidarity in parties. Just like every year, we will vote and elect this year’s hate speech champions among your nominations at the 13th ""Genetically Modified Tomatoes"" ceremony. We will extend our rebellion with our comrades coming from other cities for the Pride Week. We will continue to spread throughout the city and shout out loud that ""we are here"" with our stencils and our annual exhibition, which is organised with an open call to artists and through consensus.

Last year we reacted to the ban on our march by dispersing into every corner of Istanbul with glitter, confetti and rainbow flags, reading our press statements. We raised our voice not only on Istiklal Street but on every place and every space possible to make ourselves to be heard. From this point on, in the face of the every obstacle put on our way, every problem that makes our lives harder, we will continue to react even more creatively than ever before. We are not giving up on the streets, we are not letting any kind of fear to scare us away. We are here, we are not leaving, and get used to it!

We are waiting for your donations for the expenses of this week-long organisation that is put together with a collective solidarity without any funds granted:

• Travel and accommodation expenses for the local LGBTI+ organisations coming from all across Turkey

• Travel and accommodation for the panelists

• Communication/Press expenses (i.e. social media, website hosts) 

• Genetically Modified Tomato Awards (i.e. production, décor, video recordings and editings)

• Event expenses (i.e. security, fees for some event spaces if necessary)

• Pride Week Exhibition (exhibition setup)

 

*In the first descriptive title, we couldn't add ""+"" to ""LGBTI"" that we added a year ago to celebrate every kind of romantic/sexual orientation because of Indiegogo's interface structure, We are still working on that problem to solve it.
column2:
>❀❀❀

 

İstanbul LGBTİ+ Onur Haftası bu yıl 25 yaşında!

Her sene yapılan açık çağrılarla bir araya gelen gönüllü grubunun kolektif katkılarıyla hazırlanan Onur Haftası 19-25 Haziran 2017 tarihlerinde gerçekleşecek.

Şimdiye kadar “Dikkat Aile Var!”, “Tabu”, “Bellek”, “Direniş”, “Temas”, “Normal?” ve son olarak da “Örgütleniyoruz!” temalarıyla şekillenen Onur Haftası'nda hafta boyunca LGBTİ+ hareketinin gündemini oluşturan sağlık, görünürlük ve anayasal haklar gibi konularda yaptığımız forumlar, paneller ve etkinliklere ek olarak, OHAL'e ve her gün artan baskılara rağmen nasıl politik bir aradalığı örebileceğimizi, bunun için nasıl alternatif yollar bulabileceğimizi konuşacağız.

Birbirimize dokunmak, yaralarımızı sarmak, güvenli alanlar oluşturarak deneyimlerimizi, bedenlerimizi ve duygularımızı konuşabilmek için atölyelerde, bir aradalığımızı kutlamak için partilerde buluşacağız. Bu sene de 13. Hormonlu Domates Ödülleri ile bu yılın nefret söylemlerini sizin belirlediğiniz adaylarla oylamaya sunarak seçecek, hafta boyunca yapılacak partiler ile her şehirden İstanbul LGBTI+ Onur Haftası için gelen yüzlerce kişiyle beraber eğlenerek varoluşumuzu kutlamaya, isyanımızı güçlendirmeye devam edeceğiz. Her sene yine açık çağrı ve konsensusla içeriğini oluşturduğumuz sergimizle ve stensillerimizle şehre dağılmaya, hala burada olduğumuzu bağırmaya devam edeceğiz.

Geçtiğimiz sene yürüyüşlerimize gelen yasaklamalara tepkimizi İstanbul’un her bir köşesine simlerle, konfetilerle, gökkuşağı bayraklarıyla dağılarak, basın açıklamamızı okuyarak gösterdik. Sözümüzü sadece İstiklal Caddesi üzerinde değil, bulunduğumuz her noktada ve sesimizi duyurabildiğimiz her alanda söyledik. Bundan sonra da önümüze çıkarılan her engelde ve hayatımızı zorlaştıran her sorunda bir öncekinden daha farklı ve daha yaratıcı olarak tepkimizi ortaya koymaya devam edeceğiz. Sokakları da caddeleri de bırakmıyor, hiçbir korkunun bizi hizaya sokmasına izin vermiyoruz. Buradayız, alışın, gitmiyoruz!

Kolektif bir dayanışma ile fon alınmadan hazırlanan bu hafta içerisinde bazı masraflarımız için herkesin desteğini bekliyoruz:

• Türkiye'nin dört bir yanından gelen LGBTİ+ yerel örgütlerinden gelecek kişilerin ulaşım ve konaklama masrafları

• Panel Katılımcılarının ulaşım ve konaklama masrafları

• İletişim/Basın harcamaları (Sosyal medya, websitesi sağlayıcıları)

• Hormonlu Domates Ödül Töreni (Prodüksiyon, dekor, video çekimleri) 

• Etkinlik harcamaları (Güvenlik, bazı mekan sağlayıcıları)

• ""Nerdeen Nereye"" sergisi (Sergi kurulumu)

 

*İlk başlıkta geçen sene ""LGBTİ"" harflerine eklediğimiz ve tüm romantik/cinsel yönelimleri kapsayan ""+"" ibaresi Indiegogo'nun arayüzü dolayısıyla şu anda eklenememiştir, bu konu üzerine çalışıyoruz.
